channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024030222
item.description:
Report X-2024030222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking and on its side. Package was opened and a LQ item was inside. Package was placed into a haz bag and tote. Tote was taken to a QA area. DescribePack: 2 plastic bottles emptied inside inner box from caps coming off. Package leaked out the bottom and side of box. Box had no outside marking/labels. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a 2nd haz bag to prevent further leakage. Bottles were adjusted to be upright.

item.title: Report X-2024030379
item.description:
Report X-2024030379

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading trailer 557169 from SCHG the haz mat was discovered wet and had leaked onto another haz mat package. Both haz mats were put in totes and taking to the Haz Mat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Found a crack on the damaged bottle. On the inside of the handle the seam is cracked about an inch or more. Hard to see the crack initially. The outer package was so damaged from the leak that the top half of the box was gone. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: There was no more leaking once package was found. Cleaned up any mess leftover and put all bottles upright in totes and put in hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2024030169
item.description:
Report E-2024030169

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 28, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of power-max plus (NA1993) was damaged by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel containerized the one (1) 55-gallon damaged metal drum into an overpacked metal drum. The utilized PPE waste was containerized to one (1) 5-gallon bucket. All waste generated was staged on site for further handling.

item.title: Report E-2024030165
item.description:
Report E-2024030165

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of about 15 lbs of "Provox C" (UN3378) onto the dock floor from (2) 55lb paper bags. The spill was caused by the failure of the previous terminal to properly loaded the freight onto the trailer, ripping both bags. The SDS for the product was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that the terminal could safely clean the residue with the PPE available, and would contain the waste in a 35gal poly drum which was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • City: MAPLETON

  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING LOADING OPERATION METER MALFUNCTION ON LOADING SYSTEM CAUSING OVERFILLING OF CTMV. OPERATION HALTED, EXCESS MATERIAL DRAINED, UNIT CLEANED BY PLANT PERSONNEL AND PROPERLY PREPARED FOR TRANSPORTATION. DELIVERY COMPLETED WITHOUT ADDITIONAL INCIDENT.
